title: Firefox 22.0a2 Aurora

notes.note: Windows: Firefox now follows display scaling options to render text larger on high-res displays
Mac OS X: Download progress in Dock application icon
HTML5 audio/video playback rate can now be changed
Scrolling using some high-resolution-scroll aware touchpads feels slow
asm.js optimizations (OdinMonkey) enabled for major performance improvements
Social services management implemented in Add-ons Manager
Pointer Lock API can now be used outside of fullscreen
Improved memory usage and display time when rendering images
Improved WebGL rendering performance through asynchronous canvas updates
Plain text files displayed within Firefox will now word-wrap
For user security, the |Components| object is no longer accessible from web content
Replace fixed-ratio audio resampler in webrtc.org capture code with Speex resampler and eliminate pseudo-44000Hz rate
CSS3 Flexbox implemented and enabled by default
Added clipboardData API for JavaScript access to a user's clipboard

If you try to start Firefox using a locked profile, it will crash (see [573369][1])


  [1]: http://bugzilla.mozilla.org/573369

system_requirements:
Windows

Operating Systems
  • Windows XP SP2
  • Windows Server 2003
  • Windows Vista
  • Windows 7
  • Windows 8

Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Firefox 22, only 32-bit builds of Firefox 22 are supported at this time.

Recommended Hardware
  • Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
  • 512MB of RAM
  • 200MB of hard drive space

Mac

Operating Systems
  • Mac OS X 10.6
  • Mac OS X 10.7
  • Mac OS X 10.8
Recommended Hardware
  • Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
  • 512 MB of RAM
  • 200 MB hard drive space

Linux

Software Requirements

Please note that Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.

  • Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    • GTK+ 2.18 or higher
    • GLib 2.22 or higher
    • Pango 1.14 or higher
    • X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    • libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
  • For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    • NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    • DBus 1.0 or higher
    • HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    • GNOME 2.16 or higher
